segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is pouring out of that sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s just gushing over the edge, and the woman doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger by the second, spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and the wood is probably warping already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a waste, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are too busy with the cookies, and the woman is in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for whoever has to clean this up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s just a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
